item.title: create fda internal user
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Adding an internal user to FDA Confluence

Revision History:
    2015-04-09 17:23:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
    http://wcdsso.cloud.hhs.gov:8080/openam
    http://fdateam.betobaccofree.hhs.gov

Prerequisites
You have administrative access to the FDA Confluence site.
You are on HHS VPN.

Useful applications: Apache Directory Studio

Logging Into FDA Confluence
1) Log into OpenAM at http://wcdsso.cloud.hhs.gov:8080/openam 
2) Open a new browser to http://fdateam.betobaccofree.hhs.gov


Creating the account
1) Using Apache Directory Studio poll LDAP (10.153.87.43) for the user’s information. 
2) Confirm that a user is created in LDAP.
3a) If the user exists then add them to the FDA user’s group.
3b) If the user does not exist in LDAP , create the user in LDAP.
4) Once the user exists in LDAP, log into FDA confluence > Users. Add the user into Confluence. We are basically creating the user locally. The password can be anything since authentication is handled by OpenAM. To better understand this, the Confluence application does not authenticate against LDAP. Instead, Confluence authenticates against OpenAM. It is OpenAM that authenticates against LDAP. Therefore, the user that is created in Confluence should match the user that exists in LDAP.


Misc Notes
To gain access to FDA Confluence, you will need to have an account created there(I’m talking about theConfluence application). If you do not you will be unable to even get to the landing page. Receiving an error about an infinite redirect loop indicates that you do not have access to FDA Confluence. The best person to talk to is Pedro.

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: new fda jira user
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Creating new LDAP user in HHS

Revision History:
    2018-08-17 11:25:07 - Version 1 created by bao-bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Applies to
- FDA environment

Prerequisites
— Ticket exists in Jira for this request
- At a minimum, the following information is available for this user:
First Name
Last Name
email
HHS ID
- Anthony Hamilton has approved the request for the new user

CI:
- fda-extldap-01.svcs.hhs.local
- fdatracker.betobaccofree.hhs.gov

Steps:
- Create the user in fda-extldap-01.svcs.hhs.local (I assume that this uses the old ldap script - we will need to update the new script accordingly)
- In apache studio, just do a once-over and confirm that the user's information that you added is correct.
- While in apache studio add the user to cn=fda-external-jira
eg:
  If the UID is alex.meza
     Then
  Add this entry to CN=fda-exgternal-jira
     uid=alex.meza,ou=people,dc=domain,dc=local
- In https://fdatracker.betobaccofree.hhs.gov, Click the Settings Icon> User management > User Directories > Synchronise the ***** External LDAP server *****
- Click on Users, filter for the new user, and click that user.
- In Application access check JIRA Software.

- Done

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```
